article.title: The VLA-COSMOS 3 GHz Large Project: The cosmic star formation history since z 5

choices: The number and luminosity of radio-excess AGN galaxies as a function of redshift.
The number and luminosity of star-forming galaxies and radio-excess AGN galaxies as a function of redshift.
The redshift distribution of all galaxies in the COSMOS field.
The relationship between radio luminosity and star formation rate.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the completeness corrections shown in Figure 2?
choices: To correct for the different sensitivities of the optical and radio telescopes.
To account for missing faint optical-NIR sources in the COSMOS2015 catalog.
To correct for resolution bias, nonuniform rms, and flux density redistribution.
To ensure that the redshift distribution of the radio sources is complete.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is represented by the black line in Figure 3?
choices: The average radio luminosity of all galaxies in the local universe.
The best-fit analytical form for the local radio luminosity function of star-forming galaxies.
The predicted evolution of the radio luminosity function with redshift.
The observed distribution of radio luminosities for star-forming galaxies in the COSMOS field.
The total integrated infrared luminosity of a galaxy.
The dust extinction needed to correct UV magnitudes.
The star formation rate of a galaxy based on its radio luminosity.
